question.title: JAXB (javax.xml.bind) won’t unmarshal nested <TMI> element (siblings bind fine). How should I annotate?
question.body:
I’m unmarshalling an incoming XML into POJOs using JAXB (javax.xml.bind) with @XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.FIELD). Most fields under bind correctly for me (e.g. asFer, square, SOY, ab), but the nested element never binds—ls.getTmi() is always null.

Incoming XML (simplified)

 <instPayment>
  <expl>dene</expl>
  <LayerService>
    <AsFer>987654321</AsFer>
    <Square>
      <SquareTr>10</SquareTr>
      <SquareRf>ABC</SquareRf>
    </Square>
    <SOY>111</SOY>
    <Ab>
      <AbTr>20</AbTr>
      <AbRf>test</AbRf>
    </Ab>
    <TMI>
      <TMITr>30</TMITr>
      <TMIRf>123-987654</TMIRf>
    </TMI>
  </LayerService>
</instPayment>

Current POJOs (the ones I’m actually using now)

LayerService.java

package tr.gov.ptt.aaa;

import javax.xml.bind.annotation.*;
import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.Setter;

@XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.FIELD)
@Setter
@Getter
public class LayerService{
    String asFer;
    Square square;
    Ab ab;
    String SOY;

    @XmlElement(name = "TMI")
    TasaMasaIsa tmi;

    public LayerService() {
        this.asFer= "";
        this.SOY= "";
    }
}

TasaMasaIsa.java

package tr.gov.ptt.aaa;

import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.Setter;

import javax.xml.bind.annotation.*;

@XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.FIELD)
@Setter
@Getter
public class TasaMasaIsa{
  @XmlElement(name = "TMITr")
  String tmiTr;

  @XmlElement(name = "TMIRf")
  String tmiRf;

  public TasaMasaIsa() {
    this.tmiTr= "";
    this.tmiRf= "";
  }
}

Other siblings (e.g., ab) are read fine in my working setup, but <TMI> never binds. TasaMasaIsa tmi= ls.getTmi(); is always null. What’s the correct way to annotate these classes so that the nested <TMI> element binds?

answers.body:
Your code is missing @XmlRootElement in your LayerService.java. The TasaMasaIsa.java does not have @XmlRootElement. The LayerService.java refers to it via a field, which is annotated with @XmlElement(name = "TMI"). JAXB expects a class level annotation to link the XML element to the class.

Therefore, annotate the TasaMasaIsa.java with @XmlRootElement(name = "TMI"). This will inform JAXB about the root element name for that class. Your code should then look like this:

package tr.gov.ptt.aaa;

import lombok.Getter;
import lombok.Setter;

import javax.xml.bind.annotation.*;

@XmlRootElement(name = "TMI")
@XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.FIELD)
@Setter
@Getter
public class TasaMasaIsa {
  @XmlElement(name = "TMITr")
  String tmiTr;

  @XmlElement(name = "TMIRf")
  String tmiRf;

  public TasaMasaIsa() {
    this.tmiTr= "";
    this.tmiRf= "";
  }
}

79758412.body: @eddasahin61 Could you describe the error? More detail please.
